result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with Macy's
Cooperate with the department. Restitution set at zero.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant. Court ordered defendant provide DNA sample;surcharge WAIVED as there is a previous sample on file and lack of ability to pay.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:.Firearm possession; Voting.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

records.descr: Referral by DOC to sentencing court

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (14 pages) commencing APRIL 18, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson in custody.  Megan P Carmody for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 months, with credit for 102 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 months; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 months.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of extended supervision:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Seek and maintain full time employment
-Restitution set at zero
-No contact with Macys
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--surcharge waived as there is a previous sample on file and lack of ability to pay.
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 
Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw

Defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson in custody.  Zak Wittchow with James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.   Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court, defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson not in court, in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court, defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson not in court, in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel to explore defendants DTC eligibility.  Status conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL MACY'S STORES IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION for DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth Darnell Wilson
Current: 3458 N 17th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 01-08-2014)
Prior: 3458 N 17th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Kenneth Darnell Wilson in custody.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
